item.title: GPU synchronization in Godot 4.3 is getting a major upgrade
item.description: Say goodbye to placing barriers, hello to the new acyclic graph
item.dc:creator: Darío Banini

item.title: Godot Does Conferences - Meet us at GDC!
item.description: We are excited to announce that the Godot Engine will attend the 2024 Game Developers Conference (March 18-22).
item.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 3
item.description: A month's worth of development means a lot of new features to test, such as single-threaded web exports and Wayland support!
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: January Jams
item.description: Looking back at a month of game jams, we curated a list of ten events that you might or might not have heard of before.
item.dc:creator: Nathalie Galla

item.title: Current state of C# platform support in Godot 4.2
item.description: How the transition to a unified .NET has impacted platform support, and re-adding the ability to port to mobile.
item.dc:creator: Raul Santos

item.title: Release candidates: Godot 4.1.4 RC 1 & 4.2.2 RC 1
item.description: As a double-feature release, Godot 4.1.4 and 4.2.2 are ready for testing with their respective release candidates!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 3.6 beta 4
item.description: Godot 3.6 is still in development, slowly but steadily! This snapshot updates toolchains for official builds and adds official Linux ARM binaries, among other improvements.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Godot Rendering Priorities: January 2024
item.description: 4.2 brought a lot of improvements to Godot's renderer and ongoing work is paving the way for new features
item.dc:creator: Clay John

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 2
item.description: After a well-deserved holiday break, the team is back on Godot 4.3 development at full speed, with over 200 improvements merged in the first 10 days of the year!
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 1
item.description: We're ending the year with an early sneak peak at the upcoming Godot 4.3 release with its first dev snapshot!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Prepare to hear a lot more from us!
item.description: The Godot Foundation is onboarding a person in charge of Community & Communications, and there is a feedback form for you to fill out.
item.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

item.title: Announcing a collaboration with Google and The Forge
item.description: We are excited to announce that we have partnered with Google and The Forge to bring some helpful performance optimizations to our Vulkan mobile backend.
item.dc:creator: Clay John

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.2.1
item.description: This first maintenance release fixes a number of platform compatibility issues introduced in Godot 4.2, which should make it much easier to upgrade from 4.1 or start new projects on all platforms.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Introducing the new Godot Forum
item.description: We are finally unveiling the new Godot forum which replaces our Q&A platform while unlocking many new features.
item.dc:creator: Winston Yallow

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.2.1 RC 1
item.description: Godot 4.2 was released one week ago, and as is customary with feature updates, we have a late harvest of regression fixes to offer!
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Godot Foundation Update 2023
item.description: This year has marked significant milestones for the Godot Foundation, and it's all thanks to the incredible support from our community.
item.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

item.title: Godot 4.2 arrives in style!
item.description: Godot 4.2 brings more rendering features and better platform support, it's also faster, easier to use, and more reliable!
item.dc:creator: Godot contributors

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.2 RC 2
item.description: The first release candidate brought another crop of regression reports, which we've now fixed!
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Submissions open for Godot 2023 showreel!
item.description: Showcase your Godot creations in 2023! We're inviting submissions of short videos featuring your published or in-progress Godot games or tools. Don't miss this chance to be a part of it!
item.dc:creator: Emi

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.2 RC 1
item.description: With every critical bug identified and squashed, we are making our last turn and preparing to sprint to the finish line with Godot 4.2!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 6
item.description: We're almost ready for a release candidate! This 6th beta fixes a number of regressions via some relatively core changes which will need thorough testing.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 5
item.description: More critical fixes are coming your way on the road to Godot 4.2 stable, including smoother transition for 3D projects made in 4.1.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.1.3
item.description: With stability in mind, Godot contributors offer yet another set of changes for Godot 4.1 users, addressing a variety of bugs related to rendering, input, GUI, and platform support.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 beta 4
item.description: We continue iterating quickly on beta snapshots for Godot 4.2 to ensure that we can solve regressions before the stable release.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde
